title: 3 Simple Ways to Save a New Contact on Android

steps.title: Open the Contacts app.
steps.content: Open the Contacts app. You’ll usually find it on the home screen or in the app drawer. Look for the outline of a person’s head and shoulders on a blue or green background. These steps are specific to Google Contacts, but will also work for the default Contacts app that some manufacturers, like Samsung, use. You can download and use Google Contacts for free from the Google Play Store.

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . The color may vary. You’ll typically find it at the top or bottom-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Select a location.
steps.content: Select a location. If prompted, select an account or location for synchronizing your new contact. You’ll usually be able to choose Device (your Android), SIM card , or your Google Account.

steps.title: Enter your new contact’s name and phone number.
steps.content: Enter your new contact’s name and phone number. Here’s how: [1] X Research source Tap next to the contact’s name to choose where to save the contact (e.g. your Google account, your SIM card). Enter the contact’s name, phone number, and/or email address in the labeled blanks. To add a photo, tap the camera icon, then select a photo. To add more details, such as street addresses or notes, tap More fields .

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. On some Androids, this might be a check mark. Your new contact is saved and ready to use. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Insert a SIM card into your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Insert a SIM card into your phone or tablet. Some SIM slots are located along the narrow side of your phone, while others are beneath the battery. Click here to learn how to insert a SIM card into your Android. If your phone has an eSIM, skip this method.

steps.title: Open the Contacts app.
steps.content: Open the Contacts app. You’ll usually find it on the home screen or in the app drawer. Look for the outline of a person’s head and shoulders on a blue or green background.

steps.title: Tap Organize.
steps.content: Tap Organize . It's the thumbnail in the bottom right corner. It looks like a book with a bookmark.

steps.title: Tap Manage SIM.
steps.content: Tap Manage SIM . You might have to scroll to find this option under the "This device" header.

steps.title: Choose the Google account you want to save the contacts to.
steps.content: Choose the Google account you want to save the contacts to. Use the drop-down menu at the top next to "Save to" to change which Google account these contacts are saved to.

steps.title: Tap to select contacts, then tap Import.
steps.content: Tap to select contacts, then tap Import . These contacts will be imported to Google Contacts from your SIM card. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Phone app.
steps.content: Open the Phone app. It’s the phone receiver icon that’s typically on the home screen. If you don’t see it, you should find it in the app drawer.

steps.title: Tap the dial pad icon.
steps.content: Tap the dial pad icon. It usually looks like 9 small squares or circles. This opens the dial pad.

steps.title: Enter the new contact’s phone number.
steps.content: Enter the new contact’s phone number. Once you enter the entire number, additional options will appear.

steps.title: Tap Create new contact.
steps.content: Tap Create new contact . This opens a screen that allows you to enter additional information about the contact. If you’d rather add this new phone number to an existing contact, choose Add to contacts or Add to an existing contact instead. You’ll then be able to select the contact, and choose a type of phone number (e.g. Home, Mobile). You may have to select a location to save your contact. If prompted, choose your SIM card, device, or Google account as suggested.

steps.title: Enter your contact’s personal information.
steps.content: Enter your contact’s personal information. Enter the contact’s name into the first blank. You can also add an email address, street address, photo, and notes.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. On some Androids, this button might be a check mark. Your new contact is saved and ready to use. You can also tap the caller in your "Recents" list and select Add to Contacts to make them a contact after they've called. You can also tap Add to Existing Contact if you want to update a contact you already have, like adding a new phone number.
